sentence.text: Help us , she implored silently , not knowing whom she spoke to , and for a moment her despair went on mounting .
Touch me , she implored silently .
` Briefly , please , " implored the Speaker , to no avail .
` How can you stand it ? " implored Evelyn .
` Do n't turn it off , " implored Lydia ; ` that is my favourite song . "
` Connie , " implored Scarlet from the street .
Instead they implore scientists to ` ponder on the social implications of their work " and to become actively involved in the effort to stem the arms race .
She implores the gods for vengeance in an extended da capo air , with nine key-changes the work 's musical and dramatic climax ( movements 9b-10 : RÃ©citatif Air : D major ) .
Why , oh why , do we implore others to Honk If You Had It Last Night ?
The Indians accordingly , with every kind of entreaty , implored Alexander to let no-one molest the animal .
My imagination could not take me to such depths of anger , so I implored her to tell me what was happening before Kareem ( my husband ) paid his afternoon visit .
He communed with his mother , he implored her to drift with him .
He tells me he implored her to let him beg her release , but she refused .
She shivered in her lavendered sheets , imploring herself to rest , trying not to think of the dreadful thing Finn had said .
Suddenly he was surrounded by ten or a dozen street urchins in rags , imploring him to be generous .
When Raskolnikov goes to Sonya to declare himself , she implores him to tell her ` straight out -- without examples " .
He had completed his secondary education in Jamaica but his mother implored him to continue in England .
The Rector implored the inquiry to consider the case for living wages to be paid , as was the case in more enlightened parts of the county .
Instead , he had been answering a barrage of questions from an invited audience of supporters , who passionately implored the amiable Irishman to guide their side into the Fourth Division .
Both France and Italy implored Russia to attack to relieve their distress .
He implored the terrorists to extend their 72-hour truce , due to end at midnight .
` You 've never implored in your life , " Ruth murmured , resting her wet head on his shirt for a second before pulling away and perching on the edge of the lounger .
We 've implored at public meetings all along that nobody takes the law into their own hands .
` Oh , Hank , I 'd love to go , " she implored .
` Come now , " he implored , backing away from the bar , ` be reasonable .
` How much can a man stand ? " he implored .
After this David Bellamy was almost an anti-climax , imploring his audience not to allow the local blanket bogs be destroyed .
Do n't say a word , implored Betty silently , gazing back at her .
May I implore him now , on behalf of my hon. Friend the Member for Neath ( Mr. Hain ) , to save the 4th Volunteer Battalion ?
Some approached the Santuario on their knees for the last part of the journey , saying the Rosary and imploring the Madonna 's help .
CHRIS EUBANK will today implore his manager Barry Hearn to ` give Nigel Benn the Â£1 million he wants to fight me -- and let's get it on . "
Eyes implored other eyes , smoky and dark .
She called out for their return , she wept convulsively , she implored God . â¦
She put her hand out to him down the table , imploring him .
` What can I do ? " she had implored Nellie .
I implore you , before you write for the French stage , to listen to their operas and find out what above all pleases them .
Modigliani stopped her taxi as it was crossing Montparnasse and implored to be allowed to ride with her , and even that was relayed to her readers .
